summary.default: Mathematician-turned AI & automation developer building production-grade systems that blend machine learning, LLMs, and workflow automation to modernize public-sector services.
summary.schupan: AI/automation developer who prototypes and deploys LLM-powered systems end-to-end — from data ingestion and ETL to interactive apps — with a track record of measurable operational improvements in government.

experience.company: Van Buren County – Department of Digital Information
experience.title: Digital Solutions Specialist
bullets: Modernized county web infrastructure by migrating from CivicPlus to WordPress; built custom plugins for staff directories, document libraries, and department templates.
Designed and deployed AI-powered chatbots (Marty for resident services, Agenda Genie for commission packets, Map Buddy for GIS navigation).
Built smart automations that combine workflow tools with AI APIs — e.g., a FOIA router integrating Jotform and OpenAI to classify and route requests to departments.
Developed data pipelines for cleaning, deduplication, and integration with BS&A and Azure SQL; enabled dynamic dashboards (Looker Studio) and departmental tracking.
Led staff training on AI literacy, prompt engineering, and digital tools to build county-wide capacity for innovation.

experience.company: Purdue University Fort Wayne – Dept. of Mathematical Sciences
experience.title: Assistant Professor
bullets: Designed and taught courses in calculus, graph theory, mathematical modeling, and network science with consistently top teaching evaluations.
Published 13 peer-reviewed papers and delivered 25+ conference presentations and invited talks in combinatorics and graph theory.

experience.title: AI/Data Annotation Consultant
bullets: Evaluated and coached generative AI models in mathematical reasoning and coding dialogues to improve reliability and safety.

projects.name: FOIA Smart Automation Router (Van Buren County)
projects.description_short: LLM-assisted workflow to triage FOIA requests and route them to the correct county department.
bullets: Integrated Jotform workflows with AI APIs for automatic request analysis, classification, and departmental routing.
Reduced manual triage and improved processing speed/accuracy by embedding LLMs into a durable automation pipeline.

projects.name: Comedy Bang! Bang! Network Explorer (Independent)
projects.description_short: Analytics pipeline and visualization exploring 700+ podcast guests with graph insights surfaced in a web UI.
bullets: End-to-end pipeline from web scraping → graph analysis (Python/NetworkX) → interactive visualization (Django APIs + React/D3).
Demonstrated rapid prototyping of data products that combine ML/analytics with intuitive, user-facing interfaces.

projects.name: Preferential Attachment Interactive Demo (Independent)
projects.description_short: Interactive teaching tool to show how preferential attachment shapes large network growth.
bullets: Visualization of network growth dynamics with adjustable parameters for classroom and outreach contexts.
Optimized rendering and UX to handle large simulated networks in the browser.

projects.name: AI Users Group Survey Dashboard
projects.description_short: Built a lightweight ETL pipeline to collect and visualize regional survey data on AI readiness across Michigan local governments.
bullets: Designed end-to-end workflow connecting Jotform → Google Sheets → Google Apps Script → Looker Studio to enable near-real-time data flow.
Automated extraction and cleaning of form submissions to reduce manual processing and support frequent updates.
Normalized multi-select survey fields by producing cleaned and long table structures for robust analysis.
Developed an interactive Looker Studio dashboard with filters, role-based segmentation, and participation metrics for stakeholders.
Delivered a transparent, maintainable data pipeline that enabled public-sector teams to explore AI engagement trends statewide.

projects.name: Van Buren County Website Modernization
projects.description_short: Comprehensive modernization of Van Buren County’s digital infrastructure, rebuilding the public website and backend systems to improve accessibility, automation, and long-term maintainability.
bullets: Led migration from CivicPlus to a custom WordPress environment (CityGov child theme) with custom plugins supporting county operations, improving maintainability and accessibility.
Built and maintained plugins for county directory, notice banners, bids & RFPs manager, and public notices, reducing manual publishing tasks and standardizing content.
Replaced Airtable workflows with a unified PostgreSQL (PostGIS) County Knowledge Base, designing schemas for people, departments, roles, and content to enable structured data access.

Automated ingestion, cleanup, and bi-directional synchronization between WordPress, Google Sheets, and Airtable using Python scripts, Google Apps Script, and Power Automate, cutting data reconciliation time.
Integrated AI/chatbot systems (OpenAI API, Chatbase, custom ingestion) to power the county assistant “Marty,” enabling dynamic queries against the County Knowledge Base.
Implemented GitHub-based pipeline with staging/production sync, WP-CLI automation, and SSH deployments to enforce version-controlled releases and rollback capability.
Collaborated cross-departmentally (Administration, IT, Treasurer, Sheriff) to align digital workflows with operational needs and compliance, increasing departmental content ownership.
Improved public communication and transparency with structured content models, accessible templates, sitewide alerts, and department-level editing workflows.

projects.name: AI Task Force Meetings
projects.description_short: Coordinated and documented the Van Buren County AI Task Force to align departments around a unified, responsible, and transparent approach to AI adoption in government operations.
bullets: Facilitated cross-department collaboration between administrative, IT, and public service divisions to identify practical AI and automation opportunities, resulting in prioritized pilot initiatives.
Developed shared language, policy frameworks, and governance principles to guide ethical, transparent AI adoption across departments.
Synthesized technical and policy discussions into accessible summaries and actionable next steps for leadership, accelerating decision-making and pilot approvals.
Supported creation of communication strategies, newsletters, and internal briefings to increase staff awareness and engagement with AI initiatives.
Defined evaluation standards for pilot AI systems balancing innovation with data privacy, compliance, and operational readiness.
Established documentation and data structures for meeting transcripts, outcomes, and ongoing project tracking to ensure continuity and institutional learning.

web_cloud.label: Google Apps Script / Google Sheets Automation
